 3.3 - INPUT ASSISTANCE
ERROR IDENTIFICATION(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

If an input error is automatically detected, the item that is in error is
identified and the error is described to the user in text. 

These websites...

Help users avoid and correct mistakes.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 Providing multiple cues 

The user fails to fill in two fields on the form. In addition to describing the
error and providing a unique character to make it easy to search for the fields,
the fields are highlighted in yellow to make it easier to visually search for
them as well. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/error-identification.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
